#Yabby-A
```{r YAB-A}
# Load the required library
library(ggplot2)

# Create the dataset
data <- data.frame(
  group = c("April vegetative", "April female", "October vegetative", "September female"),
  expression = c(2.67324, 0.6055, 1.56246, 1.45938),
  err_min = c(2.44008, 0.55416, 1.34457, 1.26953),
  err_max = c(2.92867, 0.66159, 1.81567, 1.67763)
)

# Create the barplot with error bars
YabA <- ggplot(data, aes(x = group, y = expression)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "skyblue", color = "black") +
  geom_errorbar(aes(ymin = err_min, ymax = err_max), width = 0.2) +
  labs(
    title = "Expression Levels of YABBY-A",
    x = "Group",
    y = "Expression Level"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

pdf(file = "/home/st-analysis_home/sami.saarenpaa/runs/Spruce/YABBYA_qPCR.pdf", width = 8, height = 6)
YabA
dev.off()

```


```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
# Data
data <- data.frame(
  group = rep(c("April vegetative", "April female", "October vegetative", "September female"), each = 3),
  expression = c(2.22727, 2.93148, 2.92585,  # April vegetative
                 0.56273, 0.54618, 0.72227,  # April female
                 2.06966, 1.48787, 1.2387,  # October vegetative
                 1.46967, 1.85117, 1.14247)  # September female
)

# Perform ANOVA
anova_result <- aov(expression ~ group, data = data)
summary(anova_result)

# Perform pairwise t-tests
pairwise_t <- pairwise.t.test(data$expression, data$group, p.adjust.method = "bonferroni")
pairwise_t


```
